## GAD-7 vs ESYTC

GAD-7 vs ESYTC: A Study in Questionnaire Harmonisation In the realms of psychology research and exploration, comparison of different data sets like GAD-7 and ESYTC often becomes crucial. However, the manual harmonisation of these data sets turns out to be a hefty and subjective task. As such, GAD-7 vs ESYTC tends to be a time-consuming procedure that requires meticulous effort and attention to detail. This is where Harmony comes into play. This innovative software leverages the power of natural language processing and generative AI models to streamline questionnaire harmonisation, making the task as simple as a drag-and-drop.

## Utilising Harmony for Efficient GAD-7 vs ESYTC Comparison

Harmony, with its potent AI models, simplifies the comparison between GAD-7 and ESYTC. The software breaks down individual items in both the questionnaires and structure a percentage match for each item. That too, in a remarkably user-friendly interface that can be accessed at https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app. With Harmony, connecting the dots between GAD-7 and ESYTC becomes much more efficient, enabling psychologists to effectively validate results and observe patterns across diverse studies with ease.


## Questions in GAD-7

|   No. | GAD-7 English                                                                                                                                      |
|------:|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|     1 | Feeling nervous, anxious, or on edge                                                                                                               |
|     2 | Not being able to stop or control worrying                                                                                                         |
|     3 | Worrying too much about different things                                                                                                           |
|     4 | Trouble relaxing                                                                                                                                   |
|     5 | Being so restless that it is hard to sit still                                                                                                     |
|     6 | Becoming easily annoyed or irritable                                                                                                               |
|     7 | Feeling afraid, as if something awful might happen                                                                                                 |
|     8 | If you checked any problems, how difficult have they made it for you to do your work, take care of things at home, or get along with other people? |
